name: Each opened file must be closed
description: This rule searches for Cobol programs in which a file is opened and not closed.
output:
Associated to each COBOL Program with violations, the Quality Rule provides:
- The Cobol File Link name
- Bookmarks for violation patterns found in source code:
    - FD clause associated to the file
    - OPEN statement
rationale: Each file used by a program must be properly opened and closed. It is especially important for temporary datasets that are allocated in the step that executes the Cobol programs. If the file is not closed explicitly, then data can be lost.
remediation: For each Cobol programs using files, check if files are closed. If not, then add a CLOSE statement at the end of the program.
remediationSample:
PROCEDURE DIVISION
       0000-MAIN.
           OPEN OUTPUT DTA-FILE.
           PERFORM 1000-PROC1.
           CLOSE DTA-FILE.
           STOP RUN.
           
       1000-PROC1.
           ...
           MOVE VAR-01 TO DTA-FILE-REC.
           WRITE DTA-FILE-REC.

qualityStandards.name: MIPS Reduction - focus on data access efficiency
qualityStandards.description: MIPS Reduction assess the level of resources that are wasted on account of sub-optimal coding regarding Efficiency and Robustness areas. Sub-optimal coding regarding Efficiency cause unnecessary consumption of resources, that will ultimately cause unnecessary consumption of electrical power when applications run in production. Sub-optimal coding regarding Robustness cause unnecessary consumption of resources, when it comes down to application shutdown and restart because it failed or because its integrity was corrupted.
